briefTitle: Safety and Immunogenicity of 3 Lots of Cell-derived Subunit Influenza Vaccine as Compared to 1 Lot to Egg-derived Subunit Influenza Vaccine in Healthy Adults (>=18 to <=60)
officialTitle: A Phase III, Randomized, Controlled, Observer-Blind, Multi-Center Study to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity of a Single Intramuscular Dose of Three Lots of a Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Produced in Mammalian Cell Culture Or of a Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Produced in Embryonated Hen Eggs, in Healthy Adult Subjects Aged >=18 to <=60

interventions.name: Cell-Derived Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Lot 1 (cTIV)
Cell-Derived Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Lot 2 (cTIV)
Cell-Derived Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Lot 3 (cTIV)

summary: The present study aims to evaluate safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of three lots of Chiron's cell-derived subunit influenza vaccine in healthy adult subjects as compared to a conventional egg-derived control vaccine licensed in Europe.

primaryOutcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers After One Dose of Cell Culture-derived or the Egg-derived Influenza Vaccine in Adult Subjects
